Translation of 郭店楚簡-六德(en) into English.

p.seg: The gentleman, if he desires to seek the human way[…] [the way of man/the way for man to follow]
[…]the people,
the small one to cultivate his body. [person CH]
Who enacts the way must necessarily follow […]
(if not by) following the proper way,
even if Yao would seek it,
he would not get it.
Since the birth of the people
[necessarily there are husband and wife,
father and son,
lord and minister,]
[these] are the six roles.
There are those leading others,
and there are those following others,
those commanding people
and those serving people,
those instructing
and those receiving (instructions),
these are the six functions.
Since there are the six roles,
they are used to take charge of these six functions.
Once the six functions get differentiated,
they are used to make ample (=expand) the six virtues.
The six virtues […]
[…] these.
What do the six virtues refer to?
They are saintliness and wisdom,
humanity and righteousness,
loyalty and trust.
Saintliness approaches (=is closely related to) wisdom,
humanity approaches righteousness,
loyalty approaches trust.
Instituting rites and music,
establishing punishments and laws
and instructing the people so as to cause them to have direction,
if not for saints and sages,
nobody could (achieve) it.
Causing fathers and sons to be intimate
and great ministers to be harmonious
and stopping calamities and disasters in the four corners (of the world),
if not for humane and righteous people,
nobody could (achieve) it.
Uniting the people
and taking charge of the land
and fulfilling the assignments of the people in life and death,
if not for loyal and trustworthy people,
nobody could (achieve) it.
The gentleman is not partial,
like the way;
(he) leads people of […]
Even if the middle of the grasses (=far from the court),
if worthy […]
[you should be giving] prizes to him,
knowing (how) he uses his affiliations (=tendencies),
judging of his intimacy and distance (from others),
(only) considering if the proper man is in place (=available).
(If you) can get the proper man
then you should promote him,
if you cannot get the proper man
then you should stop.
[…]（entrust him with）fathers and older brothers,
entrust him with sons and younger brothers.
Those with great talents and skills should serve as great officers,
those with small talents and skills should serve as small officers,
and consequently you should confer emoluments upon them,
make them such that they are appropriate for living
and appropriate for dying,
(this) is what one calls a lord.
To use righteousness to rule people is (his) paramount (virtue)
Righteousness
is the virtue of the lord.
“Without me being intimate by blood connections,
he (=my ruler) nurtures me like his (own) son or younger brother”,
therefore it is said:
if he can increase the welfare of this man (=the ruler),
spending the energy of his viscera (=guts)
without daring to get tired of it,
risking his death
without daring to grudge about it,
(this) is what one calls [a minister].
To use loyalty to serve others is (his) paramount (virtue).
Loyalty
is the virtue of the minister.
To know what can be done,
and what cannot be done;
to know (when) to act,
and (when) not to act,
(this) is what one calls a husband
To use wisdom to rule people is (his) paramount (virtue).
Wisdom
is the virtue of the husband.
Once having being united with him,
until death one should not change it.
For this reason if the husband dies,
she (still) keeps his ancestral tablet,
not marrying (again) for the rest of her life,
this is what we call a wife.
To use trust to follow others is (his) paramount (virtue).
Trust
is the virtue of the wives.
Once they are born to nurture them
and consequently to teach them and instruct them,
is referred to as saintliness.
Saintliness
is the virtue of fathers.
As for sons,
to unite and bring together (their) best abilities to serve their superior (=their parents),
is called righteousness.
Respect (towards those) above,
righteousness (towards those) below,
to serve the altars of the soil and millet,
is called filial piety.
Therefore, for people, when they behave manly,
they are called humane.
Humanity
is the virtue of sons.
Therefore when husbands behave as husbands,
wives behave as wives,
fathers behave as fathers,
sons behave as sons,
lords behave as lords,
ministers behave as ministers,
the six of them will each perform its role,
and slanders and boastings will not have from where to arise.
Look for it in the Odes and Documents,
and it is there,
look for it in the Rites and Music
and it is there,
look for it in the Changes and in the Springs and Autumns
and it is there.
To be familiar with it, is paramount,
to be intimate with it (=the six virtues)，is paramount,
to make it beautiful (=perfect), is paramount.
The way does not stop (=is eternal).
Humanity
is internal.
Righteousness,
is external;
Rites and Music,
are (both) together (=internal and external).
The internal roles
are father son and husband,
the external roles
are lord, minister and wife.
Un-hemmed coarse clothes, hemp clothes and a stick,
it is for the (mourning of the) father,
it is the same for the (mourning of the) lord.
Un-hemmed coarse garment with frayed edges, clothes of male hemp,
it is for the (mourning of the) brothers,
it is the same for the wife.
(Wearing) clothes that leave exposed the upper body and avoiding (to wear a cap),
this is for the relatives of the main branch,
it is the same for friends.
You can interrupt (the mourning for the) lord because of the one for the father,
not interrupt the mourning for the father because of the mourning for the lord.
You can interrupt (the mourning for the) wife because of the one for the brothers,
not interrupt the mourning for the wife because of the mourning for the wife.
You can contravene (the mourning for the) friends because of the one for the relatives of the main branch,
not contravene the mourning for the relatives of the main branch because of the mourning for the friends.
Men have six virtues,
and the three intimate relationships (=lord/minister, husband/wife, father/son) should not be severed.
In taking care of the indoor (affairs),
humanity should overcome righteousness,
in taking care of outdoor (affairs),
righteousness should overcome humanity.
In (things) related to humanity
there should be expansiveness and bonding,
in things related to righteousness,
restraint and separation.
Humanity is expansive and abandoned, righteousness strong and restrained.
To express “abandon” in words,
it means to be unrestrained,
minute and far and manifold.
In expressing one’s intent
and trying to nourish the intent (=satisfy the desires) of one’s intimates,
there is nothing that cannot be used,
therefore it is unrestrained.
The difference (separation) between man and woman originates from these (six virtues),
the intimacy between father and son originates from these (six virtues),
the righteousness between lord and minister originates from these (six virtues).
The father should be saintly,
the son humane,
the wife trustworthy,
the lord righteous,
the minister loyal.
Saintliness begets humanity,
wisdom commands trust,
righteousness causes loyalty.
Therefore if husbands behave as husbands,
wives as wives,
fathers as fathers,
sons as sons,
lords as lords,
ministers as ministers,
with the six of them each performing its role,
then slanders and boastings do not have from where to arise.
As for the gentleman, his words are sincere and that’s it,
his words are warm and that’s it,
he brings together internal and external (factors) so that in all cases there is gain.
In contrast,
if husbands do not behave as husbands,
wives do not behave as wives,
fathers do not behave as fathers,
sons do not behave as sons,
lords do not behave as lords,
ministers do not behave as ministers,
this is from where confusion arises.
The gentleman not only understands the smallest (pains) of the people,
but also knows their oneness (=entirety?).
If there is no differentiation between man and woman,
father and son are not intimate;
if father and son are not intimate,
lord and minister have not righteousness.
This is the reason why the former kings in teaching people
started from filial piety and brotherly affection;
on this side, the gentleman
has nothing to discard (=he must be very attentive).
This is the reason why the former kings in teaching people
did not cause the people to worry about themselves (=their livelihood),
losing (sight of) this side (=filial piety).
Filial piety
is the root.
Cultivating its root below,
you can interrupt slander.
(Since) the begetting of the people then there necessarily are husbands and wives,
fathers and sons,
lords and ministers.
If the gentleman is enlightened about this six things,
then he can interrupt slander.
The way cannot be partial,
if you can only protect one nook (of it),
how can you avoid its（turning）ugly?
Therefore the interrupting of slander must be prompt.

In general the great rules by means of which the gentleman can establish himself are three (=separation between husband and wife, intimacy between father and son, righteousness between lord and minister),
and (his ways of) unfolding them (=their applications) are six (=the six virtues),
and their threads are twelve (=the six roles and the six functions).
If the three are unobstructed,
speech and acts are both unimpeded.
If the three are obstructed,
speech and acts are caused to be incorrect.
If the three are unobstructed in all cases,
then (everything) is correct.
These three (rules)
stand together with the gentleman when he is born,
and decay with him at his death.
[…] birth.
Therefore it is said:
“for the mother and father of the people (=the lord) to be intimate with the people is easy,
but causing them to be intimate among themselves is difficult.
